review_title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
SENSORY RELIEF
review_text: I have not used noise cancelling headphones before but after my confirmed Autism diagnosis I have realized much of what I thought was anxiety is actually sensory overwhelm. I decided to try these first to see if headphones are something that will help me before spending over $150 for the more recommended pairs.Upon just placing them on your head (not turning on) the sounds around me are already muffled. The moment I turned them on it was further improved and the holy-amazing-batman sound cancellation was clear the moment the noise cancelling turned on. Then when connected to my phone to play lofi music is the next best thing to being in a quiet room by myself. I have been wearing them for about twenty minutes and I already feel so relaxed whereas my child and mother are talking on the sofa next to me and only hear a light sound every couple minutes compared to the constant talking I would be hearing without that would slowly drive me to full blow irritation and aggravation. They have not started to bother my ears yet or give me a headache. Time will tell how they hold up and how long I can use them before getting uncomfortable.

The only way I can hear someone is when they get right next to me and speak pretty loudly.Also the Be-Aware mode is incredible for looking busy while still being able to hear what's going on around you. They even act as hearing aids so I can eavesdrop on nearby conversations.Aside from all that, they connect seamlessly, they're comfortable enough to wear for hours, and the battery lasts for weeks. Can't recommend these enough

review_title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Simple, affordable, and does the job for school use
review_text: I picked these up for my son because his school requested headphones for their learning system. Honestly, I chose them because of the low price, but I’ve been pleasantly surprised by how solid they are for under $10.The sound quality is clear enough for educational programs, videos, and even music. They’re not going to compete with high-end headphones, but they get loud enough without distorting and the voices come through sharp. The lightweight design is a big plus since my son can wear them for a while without complaining, and the padded earcups make them more comfortable than the typical budget options.Another thing I like is the fold-flat swivel design—it makes them easy to toss into a backpack without taking up a ton of space. The cord feels average (not super thick), but at this price point I wasn’t expecting premium build quality. So far, after a few weeks of use, they’ve held up fine to everyday school wear and tear.If you need a no-frills pair of wired headphones for school, travel, or as a backup, these are a great value. For less than the price of lunch, they do exactly what you need them to do.

review_title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great Value.  Good Sound.
review_text: These are economy headphones, that, for the price, sound very good.  They have neodymium magnets in them, and that helps with the sharpness of the tone. They get a decent amount of bass. If you use a preamp or mixing board with them, you can dial in a very nice sound by adjusting the tone controls.  These are far better than earbuds. Of course you're not going to get the same sound that you'd get from a more expensive set of headphones (for this I'd recommend the economy Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Studio Headphones, or for more high end detail, the industry standard Sony MDR 7506 Headphones.) These headphones are useful for casual listening, or just using for monitoring to hear other tracks, while laying down new tracks. They also can be useful for checking your mixes or masters on something that represents consumer level listening devices. They come with both a 1/8" and a 1/4" stereo plugs. For the price of these, you can't go wrong. My last pair of equivalent headphones, I bought 20 years ago (they had ferrite magnets, so are more mellow sounding) and they are still working fine. Sony does a great job on these headphones. The one thing that they could improve on, with these new ones is: Lengthening the cord. It's pretty short. (My old Sony MDR-V250 headphones, came with a much longer cord. They are the predecessors to these new headphones.)

review_title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
False description. There is no mic
review_text: I really wanted a comfortable pair of over-the-ear headphones with built in mic for work and to listen to my audio books and music. During my search I came across these headphones. At first I was hesitant to purchase them because because the title of the product did not mention a mic, but when I read the description "🤳 CRYSTAL CLEAR CALLS: Furnished with cutting-edge noise-canceling microphones, these headphones ensure crystal clear and uninterrupted communication during calls, ensuring exceptional clarity and eliminating external disturbances for an impeccable conversation experience."I took the chance, but unfortunately, the description is not accurate. These headphones do not have a built-in mic (or perhaps user error?).What I do like about them is the color, fit, and battery life. It was also easy to connect to more than one device. They are also compact (fold) which makes that easier to travel with. The charging cord isn't overly log, but log enough since you are only using them for charging, as they are wireless. I am happy with the sound quality as well, though I have only used them for audiobook thus far.
